text: Are there plans to improve the search functionality in the new editor? It seems you can only search one term once (pressing enter again doesn't skip to the next occurrence of the search term), you can't use the replace functionality and once you click out of the search box, it disappears, forcing you to ctr+f again

My mistake, 
1. You can replace with crt+shft+f and replace all with ctr+shift+r 
2. You can navigate all occurrences by hitting enter

The UX is still a bit unclear though - especially with the disappear on click and the tiny input area

<@U6GNQ7JBU> ( sorry <@U3TR96G84> tagged the wrong person last time) I may be misinformed here but I thought when Multilanguage was in beta it was detecting language based on browser language by default and that was the default language it serves. Is that not correct? does it serve English by default?
I believe it detects language based on the browser language header but will serve english by default if that header is not available. Let me look at the source code :eyes:
In the new design manager is there going to be a module for HTML/HubL or are these always going to be custom modules when you want to add that code?
I believe there was talk about this <@U7P6G42AX> should know more
thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU>
<@U25EHAP7G> It defaults to the primary language you set in content settings. If you do not set a primary language, it will default to english
There is currently some ongoing discussion about this, <@U22PNRAJD> can provide some context here

Hi <@U2H3TT8F2> Our plan is to add the HTML module back(likely in February) and give users access to it by having them download it from the Marketplace. It is our opinion that anything that was formerly being built using a HubL module should now be built using a Custom Module.
Sounds good. Thanks all.
speaking of custom modules...has anyone else seen an issue where they are not available to add inside of flexible column?

Just playing around with the v2 module tool.  Find it kind of interesting that copying the snippet for a text module ends up with the snippet for the whole module and not just the value.  Can't really think of a situation where i'd want a text module to output with a div wrapping unformatted text.
As in you can't drag it inside in the UI?
from the page editor, click the + add new module, search and it is not available as an option
I'll DM you the page
works fine in the design manager
Right I am guessing because a flexible column isn't technically a module they forgot to put it in, let me ask the team
<@U26D0TF8E> do you mean you can't add any custom modules to a flex column? or just new ones?
trying to add a new/blank custom html module so client can add embedded code
inside of the flexible column...when we look at the build in modules we can add it's not showing up as an option
built*
Has anyone successfully make an RSS for for a COS webpage/site? I know HubSpot gives the option for the blogs but not seeing one for the webpage
<@U7P6G42AX> did that make sense?
:thumbsup:
Are you referring to a rss feed of all the cos pages on a site?
like a sitemap?
Is this what you're looking for? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-blog/where-can-i-find-my-HubSpot-blog-rss-feed-url>
